bug.author: sjachim
bug.summary: The width of Altair vconcat chart not set properly
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The width of the concatenated chart is not set properly. See the screenshot below. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Put in your code this: st.altair_chart(alt.vconcat(alt.layer(... Refresh your app and notice that width of the concatenated chart is wrongly set
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The vertically concatenated charts should be wide as normal charts. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
They have some small default width. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
No <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.50.2 Python version: 3.7 Using PipEnv OS version: Mac OS X Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71563/68969726-f5be0e00-07e5-11ea-9726-9478570591f3.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Hey>@Hey</denchmark-link> , thanks for the bug report! This looks similar to issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/549>#123</denchmark-link> , it’s not exactly the same bug but both share the same cause. We have a <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/684>PR</denchmark-link> open to fix this, but in the meantime you can set the width in your charts with the following snippet: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import numpy as np import pandas as pd import altair as alt
df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(200, 3), columns=[“a”, “b”, “c”]) c = alt.Chart(df).mark_circle().properties(width=500).encode(x=“a”, y=“b”, size=“c”, color=“c”).interactive() st.altair_chart(alt.vconcat(c,c)) </denchmark-code>
I’m going to close this bug so we can keep the conversation going in one location [the above linked issue]. If you think this issue is distinct from the above feel free to reopen the bug and let us know. Thanks!
